Reviews.Title: Camera's are good in the daytime
Reviews.Author: Mason T Graham
Reviews.Content: These cameras are a good value for the cost but in extreme dark areas they need lighting assistance. In well lit areas they will work great

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade option
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: I honestly owe it to the qsee community on here for their fast response to my question which allowed me to make a fast , but overall good decision. my question was answered and yes they are compatible with the night owl dvr systems and are believe to be compatible with any dvr that consist with bnc type connectors . I have a night owl security camera system that included four(12-IR)security cameras(420tvl) not bad for the price or for the urgency to protect my property a bit since my home had recently been burglarized. the night vision on these night owl is probably good for like 15' and very fuzzy defenition(off coarse not professional grade) although it did the job mean while I always felt I needed to upgrade and after about a month and consistent research/review's I did decide to go with the Qm6008b model and let me tell you that the night vision is great, the day time is even better. Very well built and sturdy. You won't be disappointed. If your property gets a bit of street light like in my case, the night vision is like a regular black and white tv image. I have had the qsee cameras(8) for about 3months and no complaint. The night owls where sold. Shop around and you may find very good deals on them

Reviews.Title: Big Improvement - Highly Recommeded
Reviews.Author: C. Hill "CFH"
Reviews.Content: These Q-See "High-Resolution 600TVL" cameras are a big improvement over the cameras that came in my Zmodo system and can be used to directly replace those cameras using the existing video/power cables. We use a zmodo system for security recording at our shop, and it generally works well except that the cameras do not always provide enough clarity for easy face recognition from a distance. These cameras are significantly better in both image clarity and night vision functionality.To be clear, this set is the 4 cameras only (with power adapter and cables) and not an actual monitoring/security system. These will all work with the systems from the major brands (Zmodo, Defender, Q-See, etc) or to any device that takes composite video in (most TVs and video recorders).These are an excellent choice when you want to upgrade just a few cameras on an existing system.Highly Recommended!CFH

Reviews.Title: Upgrade from QSM1424W
Reviews.Author: David Tullos
Reviews.Content: We bought these as an upgrade from our existing QSM1424 cameras.  They have much crisper picture picture and twice the night vision capability.  What once an ill defined black blob is now my cat.

Reviews.Title: Build quality is decent, but...
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to upgrade some older cameras I had around my property.. these installed easily and seemed to be good build quality, but were terrible with lighting.. anywhere the sun hit my yard (grass, patio, etc) totally washed out the picture.. I adjusted my DVR as much as possible but just couldn't get the picture to look good.. I ended up going back to my old cameras and returned these.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Danny Clayton Jr
Reviews.Content: Works well. The power supplies could only support 3 cameras though when in night vision mode. With 4 on the power supply in night vision mode it would cause all 4 to loss video.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Product
Reviews.Author: David K. Prevatt
Reviews.Content: Bought 4 camera's. Had cameras for only 35 days when three quit working. Sent them back and they have replaced or fixed them under warr. Since sending the three back the fourth one has quit. They shipped the three back UPS that had to be signed for, I can not take off work to wait on a truck. Did not have to sign for them when I bought them?? Stay away.......

Reviews.Title: Good Resolution
Reviews.Author: Fast Eddie
Reviews.Content: I was using QSM1424W (400 TV LINES),  these cameras (600 TV LINES) are a huge upgrade, near DVD quality.  These cameras produce crisp lines, clear pictures  with no bleeding of colors.  I want to replace all my cameras with these but management is tight with the money....

Reviews.Title: Q-See Cameras
Reviews.Author: Larry Coleman
Reviews.Content: shipment was received faster then expected, Kudos to Amazon. they are like that quite often for my orders. the cameras all tested immediatly upon arrival worked. and the quality of the picture is good enough for my application. inside my home lookingt at stategic areas. I already had a recorder and they are online recording now. no problems to report yet.

Reviews.Title: Durable, solid, and well-made cameras for home security
Reviews.Author: buru buru piggu
Reviews.Content: I had previously tested the 2-camera pack of this Q-See product. This is simply a 4-pack of the cameras, with the exact same specifications and performance. If you need 4 cameras, this pack offers much better value per camera over the 2 pack (price fluctuations notwithstanding).Made of metal, these cameras are very solidly constructed and sturdy. There is a good amount of heft to them and they are quite substantial feeling in the hand. They definitely don't feel like they'll fall apart. Setup is very easy.The cables are Y shaped on both ends, and color-coded and labeled as to which end connects to the DVR and which end connects to the camera. One small AC adapter powers both cameras. I used a BNC to RCA adapter to connect the cameras to my TV. The cable routes through the base and then through your wall, so it can't be cut from the outside by vandals or intruders. Setup was quite easy and I was ready to test out my cameras within 10 minutes of unboxing. I didn't have to calibrate the sensors.I tested the camera in normal household lighting, dim indoor and outdoor lighting, and total darkness. Under normal lighting, faces were easy to recognize. Under low lighting or darkness, the camera switches to infrared mode (color drops off) and faces become a bit harder to distinguish, but not by much. This isn't a problem unless you are trying to identify the faces of total strangers from more than 20 ft away. Clothes and other features are still clearly visible and sharp. There's no lag or interference, and what surprised me was the camera being able to catch specs of dust floating around in front of the lens! (My basement is dusty).I put one of the camera in a room of total darkness and panned it around. The infrared sensors worked impressively. I saw all my furniture and clutter in bright grey scale, with no loss of clarity. Aiming it down an unlit corridor, I got about 30 ft of clear visibility towards the back of the house. For outdoor monitoring, effective range varies a lot with lighting conditions and obstructions. You'll have to play around with placement to get the best angles and performance from the infrared LEDs. For best results, you shouldn't have any objects in your line of sight close to the camera, as the infrared will bounce off these surfaces and blow out the image to white. I had some rose bush branches near my lens, for example, which limited the range of the camera. After repositioning to a clear line of sight, I got a good view of my neighbor's porch about 30-35 ft away. I think this is the ideal radius for outdoor night-time monitoring with the Q-See. But again, your mileage may vary.

ProductInfo.Features:
4 Cameras with 600 TV Line Resolution
Weatherproof for Indoor/Outdoor Use
36 IR LEDs for 100 ft. Night Vision
60 ft. Cables included for flexible installation
ProductInfo.Name: Q-See QM6008B-4 High-Resolution 600TVL Cameras (4 Pack), Black
